title: Please don't take away our jungle items.
body:
I'm not gonna sit here and write and complain about how shitty the balance team is however I have to say their experimentation with the new jungle items right now is extremely worrying. I'm not gonna waste everyones time and preach reasons as to why you should listen to me so im just going to leave my thoughts in dot points.

1. Only one jungle item is bad: 
Limiting jungle items to simply one jungle item limits diversity and strategy for actually viable junglers who don't need their hand held.

2. Junglers reliant on certain jungle items will become horrible: 
No one wants a fiesta of 'pick this jungler or suffer' and no one wants to see their old picks being shutdown. For example, leesin will basically become useless without his ward stacks (no one wants to use pink wards to ward hop like that's just stupid), and duelists who need to be killing tanks and bruisers will suffer without red smite. Thus, we're only gonna see tank cc junglers back in the meta and no one wants that. . 

3. The new jungle item made to replace the three is actually horrible:
What's the point of giving a reward for counter jungling when that reward does effectively nothing? We can only have 1 pink ward out at a time and our stacks refresh when we go back to base, so whats the point of having over 1 stack of pink wards anyway? No one is going to be using pink wards that fast, not to mention sweeping trinket does the job of controlling vision instead of using pink wards for objectives like dragon and baron anyway. I get that the continuous pinks will help protect your jungle but that's also a redundant goal. You made it so that it will reward you for counter jungling, but also protects you from it, and since everyone has it, what's the point?

The 10% lifesteal is only useful on champions that utilise auto attacks, making ap junglers like elise, ivern, and evelyn, unable to even utilise this properly. The mana portion of the item is also useless on champions that don't use mana as their primary resource, and also promotes jungling with off-meta champions who aren't capable of jungling due to mana costs like most mages. The tooth and nail stat again, is only useful on champions who struggle with clearing the jungle. Thus the only good thing about the new smite is the active portion on champions, which is essentially the active on blue smite...

4. Already good junglers will be too efficient:
Champions who already are fast at clearing the jungle and staying healthy while utilising mana such as Kayn, will become too efficient at clearing their jungle with the health restoration on smite, the mana regen on the new item, and the damage boost for tooth and nail. Kayn and champions like him will be too efficient at jungle clears and have nowhere to go if all lanes are pushed. Meaning there's no real reason for junglers to even buy this item if they don't need the help. I would imagine people buying machete or talisman then not even bother upgrading their jungle item at all because it literally offers them nothing. 

5. There's nothing wrong with the current jungle items:
If it ain't broke, why break it? There is literally NOTHING wrong with jungling at the moment and it is in my opinion one of the most balanced and diverse roles at the moment and the only role I enjoy playing. I really don't see how a change like this is beneficial in any shape or form. It kind of feels like riot is saying "Well jungle is pretty tough so lets make it easy and forgiving to play whoever you want in the jungle" except forgetting that for BALANCE reasons, some junglers AREN'T MEANT TO.

6. No such thing as a "good" jungler:
Catch up exp is already so high, having a jungle item like this just makes playing jungle way too forgiving. There is no reward for good jungling and you become reliant on your laners to get anywhere. Back in the day I'd tell people who don't understand the game to play support and get a feel for the game, now I'd tell them to play jungle because there is literally no such thing as a good or bad jungler. Just junglers who can and can't smite baron and dragon.

7. It's pink:
I want my primary colours.

8. Mashing in together a bunch of old smite effects doesn't make it a good item.

Conclusion: Meta will be catagorised into tank junglers and junglers that don't even need the new item. CC and Gank central. No more counter jungling. Low mmr trolls incoming due to how easy clearing jungle will be, yay swain and malz jungle? I honestly hate how hand holding jungle will become.

replies.body: They already took away support items, now they're moving on to jungle items? Might as well remove a few champions as well while you're at it. Hell even remove a few towers and jungle camps, they OBVIOUSLY aren't important either.

Remember [this](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2016/10/dev-on-depth-vs-accessibility/)?

Specifically, the lines "What I’m talking about is that as a strategy, Riot decided that League wasn’t going to go after being a super easy to learn game for fear of losing the depth that the team wanted League to have.", and "But what we mean by it is: We don’t want to try to grow the League audience by making the game easy to understand and pick up."

What a crock of shit. Homogenize everything, reducing SKILL in the game, has been happening since the juggernauts updates in season 5. And changing the jungle every year for the sake of it.

Remember when they:

- made it easier for noobs to hear when baron and dragon was taken, so they didn't have to time it or ward it?
- made it easier for noobs by notifying when buffs are spawning on the mini-map

Why reduce the skill of the game? Its been disappointing that Riot do this. haven't even talked about how they reduced the skill needed to play certain champions, e.g. Graves, Alistar.

Yup, I remember back in the day when jungle camps would share exp even if you were on the other side of a wall and the mid laner would leash blue with 2 autos and an ability just to be safe they didn't take it. 

And yes I used to be a really good at the old graves, my best champ and even outplayed my diamond friends in skirmishes before they reworked him. And I hate how they made combos easy like how ali will just pulverisze at the end of his headbutt if you just mash the buttons, same with kha'zix jump now. Miss the old league.

On the other hand i'm just going to address a few things in this post;

>Only one jungle item is bad:
>Limiting jungle items to simply one jungle item limits diversity and strategy for actually viable junglers who don't need their hand held.

Given the look of the item, and how it has basically everything on it for diversity's sake, it's basically going for a jack of all trades item, and isn't necessarily bad to only have one of them, it's still a shitty change, but this item does cover all the bases.

>Junglers reliant on certain jungle items will become horrible:

No Jungler is that reliant on a specific Jungle smite that this change will make them horrible, especially since the enchantments are the same.

>What's the point of giving a reward for counter jungling when that reward does effectively nothing?

The issue is that Riot has had a terrible time working out how to incentivizing counter jungling for years, because it basically turns into "i'm buying this jungle item to counter jungle you, go ahead and stop me since i made it obvious."

We can't have a Jungle smite that is straight meant to be for countering, so i guess this is the way they decided to get around it, even though it's honestly terrible, because only one control can stand at a time and it's a waste to get a second one by countering.

Yeah their main attempt at trying to insentivize counter jungling was to give you a dirk if you bought a 500 gold item that gave you less ad than a long sword. Heaps of insentivize. Over half the junglers don't even use dirk and the good counter junglers like nunu have no reason to even buy it. If they really wanted to reward players with counter jungling they could just make it so early game jungle gold is higher from clearing the enemy jungle. WOW, SUCH HARD CHANGES.

Yeah it's the obligatory fucking of the jungle since we can't go a year without changing it.

The reasoning is generally "who want's to play the same jungle for more then a year in a row"

*looks at the lanes and how they don't change*
